net.proteusframework.core.automation

Interface DataConversion

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Task
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataConversion, DatabaseObjectConversion, SQLDataConversion

    public interface DataConversion
extends Task
    Defines a DataConversion.

    See Task.getIdentifier() and getVersion() for information on properly identifying your data conversion implementations / instances.

    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

      Comparator.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        java.util.List<? extends SQLStatement> execute(TaskArgument[] arguments)
                                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                      java.sql.SQLException,
                                                      java.lang.RuntimeException
        The SQL statements returned should not include any DDL statements. DDL statements must be returned using getPreConversionDDL() or getPostConversionDDL() Execute the task using the specified arguments. Some tasks such as DataConversions, will execute SQL statements. Other tasks may do things, like send an email in which case they will not return SQL statements.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Task
        Parameters:
        arguments - the arguments.
        Returns:
        an ordered list of loggable items from the task. If these are SQLStatements, the will be executed. Return an empty list if there or no loggable items.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are invalid.
        java.sql.SQLException - if a SQL Exception occurs.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if an error happens during execution.

      • getDependencies

        java.util.Set<DataConversion> getDependencies()
        Get other DataConversions that this DataConversion requires.
        Returns:
        the DataConversion set.

      • getPostConversionDDL

        java.util.List<SQLStatement> getPostConversionDDL()
        Get any DDL statements that must be after the conversion.
        Returns:
        the DDL statements.

      • getPreConversionDDL

        java.util.List<SQLStatement> getPreConversionDDL()
        Get any DDL statements that must be run before the conversion.
        Returns:
        the DDL statements.

      • getValidationStatements

        java.util.List<? extends SQLStatement> getValidationStatements()
        Get any validation statements the script can run after the data conversion is completed, but uncommitted.
        Returns:
        the validation statements.

      • getVersion

        int getVersion()
        Get the version.

        This number is tied to an identifier. Each data conversion for a particular identifier should have a unique version number. This is just a monotonically increasing number to identify the order to run data conversions.

        Returns:
        the version. Must be greater than 0.

      • requiresDowntime

        boolean requiresDowntime()
        Return true if the DataConversion requires downtime.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • validateResult

        @Nullable
java.lang.String validateResult(SQLStatement stmt,
                                       int index,
                                       java.sql.ResultSet result)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Validate the result of executing a validation statement.
        Parameters:
        stmt - the statement.
        index - the index of the statement returned in the last call to getValidationStatements().
        result - the corresponding result set.
        Returns:
        a string describing the invalid result or null if the validation was successful.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs
